titleStmt.title: The discovery made by Captain Mark Baggot, the person lately taken in womans clothes, coming from Limerick to Dublin, where he was apprehended, and tried as a spy, by a court-martial, on Friday last; at which he received sentence of death: but upon this confession, execution was respited. Licensed and Entered April 6. 1691. J.F.

The discovery made by Captain Mark Baggot, the person lately taken in womans clothes, coming from Limerick to Dublin, where he was apprehended, and tried as a spy, by a court-martial, on Friday last; at which he received sentence of death: but upon this confession, execution was respited. Licensed and Entered April 6. 1691. J.F.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for James Partridge at the Post-House at Charing-Cross,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.
